Summary • Web content editor/project manager with over 10 years of varied experience at Yahoo! 
 
• Extensive experience in analysis of the quality and relevance of search results. 
 
• Worked closely across functions to create customized tests that drove product improvements for Yahoo! users. 
 
• Clear and articulate communicator in oral, written, and web-based formats. Skilled in translating technical content for non-technical audiences. 
 
• Ability to learn quickly, work in fast-paced environments, and execute with driven work ethic. 
 
• Creative, critical thinker, often implementing improved processes to increase speed and efficiency. Specialties:User Support, User Operations, User Safety (Abuse Issues), Quality Analysis (QA), Search Algorithm Testing, Digital and Editorial Content, Support Documentation, Spam Detection, Bug Tracking and Escalation, Training and Mentoring, Ontology, Social Media Platforms, Project Coordination/Management. Experience Community Manager/Content Specialist and Moderator Skout.com February 2012  – Present (3 years 7 months) SF Bay Area Search Content Analyst/Project Manager Yahoo! Inc. June 2008  –  August 2010  (2 years 3 months) Ensured the integrity of Yahoo! search results by collaborating with engineers and other members of a cross-functional team to test and improve the Yahoo! search engine. 
 
• Developed test guidelines, designed and implemented tests, interpreted results, and performed quality assurance (QA) spot checking. Managed all troubleshooting and bug tracking/escalation and drove issues to resolution. 
 
• Provided logistical support for trainers so that training of new hires and contractors proceeded smoothly. Created practice tests, communicated schedules, and monitored and reported trainee progress. 
 
• Performed and participated in a wide range of editorial relevance tests. Set test schedules and milestones. 
 
• Wrote training materials. Often acknowledged for thoroughness and training materials created “from the perspective of the user." 
 
• Trained new hires, QA spot checkers, and content analysts. Presented to groups up to 100+ and remotely via Adobe Connect. Content Quality Analyst Yahoo! Inc. June 2005  –  June 2008  (3 years 1 month) Improved ranking of advertising customers by evaluating content submitted to the Search Submit Pro program. Collaborated with sales staff, technical account managers, trusted feed generators, and others to ensure that content in the program added value and relevance to the Yahoo! search index. 
 
• Determined whether submissions were appropriate for the program and, if included, made sure that they followed Yahoo! guidelines. 
 
• Analyzed the impact of feed and algorithm changes on search relevance and results diversity, determined the breadth and scope of that impact, and proposed solutions to problems. 
 
• Provided test cases and data for engineering team to use to develop machine-learning algorithms that calculated rankings, relevance, and search results. 
 
• Wrote and maintained guidelines and policies for the program. 
 
• Interviewed, trained, and mentored new hires. 
 
• Created new process for detecting and filtering out unwanted affiliate content that would lead to duplicate search results for users. Search Editor/User Support Specialist Yahoo! Inc. November 1999  –  June 2005  (5 years 8 months) Improved Yahoo! search results by reviewing, indexing, and categorizing Internet content; reducing the incidence of spam and illegal content; performing QA testing; and providing customer support to Yahoo! Search and Directory users. 
 
• Helped engineers improve search methodology by applying algorithms to selected queries, comparing results, and submitting feedback. 
 
• Ensured viability of Yahoo! products by performing QA tests of core product features and functionalities. 
 
• Provided customer support for Yahoo! Search and Directory users by answering their questions, monitoring requests and inquiry trends, and submitting summaries to use as the basis for prepared answers and scripts. Redirected inquiries to appropriate FAQs, email queues, and designated customer care contacts. 
 
• Used proprietary tools, methods, and keywords to reduce the incidence of spam and illegal content in search results. 
 
• Streamlined results for Yahoo! shoppers and helped Yahoo! merchants increase sales by creating and editing set-parameter searches, categorizing products, and creating keywords lists and image tags. Summary EXPERIENCE: 
 
I am a content management professional with 4+ years of experience working in technology and education. I design, develop, and deliver simple and straightforward help documentation to ensure the best user experience.  
 
I also love video, from production to post-production, and provided internal video services to Yahoo's CIO organization. For example, in December 2014, I produced and edited daily sizzle reels for Yahoo's seventh-annual Tech Pulse technology conference, one of which was published on Yahoo Screen.  
 
EDUCATION:  
 
I have a certificate in Technical and Professional Communication and a Master's in English Rhetoric and Composition from California State University, Long Beach. As a graduate student, I worked as a Teaching Assistant, teaching English 100: Composition II and English 419: Writing in Science, Social Science, and Technology. My research focused on new media, and I presented at national professional conferences and co-authored a chapter that explores how users produce creative work in new forms and shape the flow of media by participating in social and increasingly mobile networks.  
 
SPECIALTIES: 
 
help documentation, user education and advocacy, editing, knowledge management, knowledge-centered support, communication, video, research

Summary Professional Goal: To find a position with a dynamic organization, enabling me to use and grow my skills in: Content Management, Instructor, Quality Assurance, Project Management, or Editorial. 
 
* Extensive project and content management experience, with the ability to hit project milestones and time lines. 
* Broad experience in training users of Web applications. 
* Well-versed in writing and editing; indoctrinated with the guidelines of AP Stylebook, Chicago Manual of Style, and Copy Editing for Professionals. 
* Strong written and verbal skills, with the ability to communicate concepts to users in terms simple enough – or advanced enough – for the needs of the user. 
* Strong written aptitude, including ability to create user guides and documentation, training materials, test plans, and other documentation to facilitate and strengthen inter- and intra-group communication.

* Knowledge of administration and maintenance of an enterprise-wide issue tracking system (TeamTrack™) for a large community of engineers, product managers, and Quality Assurance groups, as well as training the user community in the tool's use. 
* Familiar with many computer operating systems, including various versions of Microsoft Windows® , Mac OS, Linux, and Solaris®. 
* Extensive knowledge of Web-based applications, including writing and editing HTML. 
* Extensive knowledge of the VLI -- a.k.a. Web Infinity -- CMS (content management system), as well as Clickability and Stellent. 
* Knowledge of the ProtoShare wireframing tool. 
* Knowledge of the RightNow CRM (customer relationship management system). 
 
Specialties: Web content management; Web analytics (Google and Omniture); project management; editing, technical writing, and proofreading; extensive knowledge of medical argot, and anatomy and physiology. Medical Advocate Medical Advocate for a Family Member (Parent) August 2005  –  February 2009  (3 years 7 months) * Medical advocate for my mother as she suffered very grave medical conditions, starting with a pulmonary embolism in 8/05 and an anti-coagulation medication reaction in 9/05 that caused many complications. Details of our experiences (and battles) are in my blog: http://ellipsesinliving.blogspot.com/2007_01_01_archive.html 
* Managed my mother's care, life, transport ... anything she couldn't handle in her delicate state. Took control of aspects of her care with the Crash Team in the hospital's ER in 07/06, as the medical team didn't respond to signals she presented. 
* My mother lived until 02/09, finally succumbing to all of the various medical issues she had suffered. I took the things I'd internalized from this experience as her medical advocate into my next position. I reacted and responded to the pressures of her situation, having experienced the chaos of an ER with a crashing patient (which is a different level of pressure), especially when that patient is a loved one, my mother. Having survived the vicissitudes that came with being the caretaker and advocate for an elderly and very ill parent, with all of the many complications and relapses she suffered, I can tackle almost anything. 
* Major accomplishment: I helped save my mother's life when she was in an ER, being treated by a team of medical professionals who were not at the top of their game. I also did all I could to make the best of what turned out to be the last few years of her life, having her live with me to place her in the center of my personal universe, which is where she needed to be to enhance her quality of life. Medical Advocate Medical Advocate for a Family Member (Parent) August 2005  –  February 2009  (3 years 7 months) * Medical advocate for my mother as she suffered very grave medical conditions, starting with a pulmonary embolism in 8/05 and an anti-coagulation medication reaction in 9/05 that caused many complications. Details of our experiences (and battles) are in my blog: http://ellipsesinliving.blogspot.com/2007_01_01_archive.html 
* Managed my mother's care, life, transport ... anything she couldn't handle in her delicate state. Took control of aspects of her care with the Crash Team in the hospital's ER in 07/06, as the medical team didn't respond to signals she presented. 
* My mother lived until 02/09, finally succumbing to all of the various medical issues she had suffered. I took the things I'd internalized from this experience as her medical advocate into my next position. I reacted and responded to the pressures of her situation, having experienced the chaos of an ER with a crashing patient (which is a different level of pressure), especially when that patient is a loved one, my mother. Having survived the vicissitudes that came with being the caretaker and advocate for an elderly and very ill parent, with all of the many complications and relapses she suffered, I can tackle almost anything. 
* Major accomplishment: I helped save my mother's life when she was in an ER, being treated by a team of medical professionals who were not at the top of their game. I also did all I could to make the best of what turned out to be the last few years of her life, having her live with me to place her in the center of my personal universe, which is where she needed to be to enhance her quality of life.
